   [h1]考迪克之诗↓[/h1]
   [b]《诗经·彼阳》[/b]

[b]彼阳若至，初升东曦。[/b]

[b]绯雾飒蔽，似幕绡绸。[/b]

[b]彼阳篝碧，雾霂涧滁。[/b]

[b]赤石冬溪，似玛瑙潭。[/b]

[b]彼阳晚意，暖梦似乐。[/b]

[b]寐游浮沐，若雉飞舞。[/b]

[h1]考迪克之诗↑[/h1]

[b]!!!军团要塞2彻彻底底的熬死了守望先锋!!![/b]

TL;DR: Nothing to see here folks, just a husk of a developer trying to wring a couple more bucks out of anyone that somehow hasn't heard of the atrocious practices of this company or the complete 180 on promises made that JUSTIFIED THE SEQUEL IN THE FIRST PLACE. Please please PLEASE, do not support this game in any way, shape or form.

Oh Blizzard, how the mighty have fallen.

As someone who played this game religiously from the first In Person Blizzcon 2014 demo until the release of Bridgette, the state of the game these days is just miserable. I remember Overwatch 2 being hyped as the 'revival' but I knew it would only end up with even more invasive monetization techniques and broken promises. The devs have gone back on BASICALLY everything promised with the release of an unneeded sequel and should be given no more room to struggle to justify this games existence. Activision has ruined this once renown game developer with corporate greed and can no longer hide their numbers and unhappy users behind an outdated and bare-bones game client. For shame Activision-Blizzard, you are a hallmark of everything wrong with the video games industry to date.
Complacency is a hell of a drug.

inb4 'review bombed' and reviews are locked/disabled by developer.

I have almost 1200 hours in this game. And you have to understand something. The Original OW was special. It was by far the best multiplayer FPS on the market when it came out. A gem of a game, polished to perfection, fun and intuitive, easy to pick up, very hard to master, but always enjoyable and satisfying. It was the real deal. And in reality, the last true Blizzard game. 

Many things led to the downfall of this glorious game. But it can all boil down to corporate greed and behind-the-scenes politics. If you never played the game before, you are served an absurdly overmonetized dish, with a tremendous amount of content locked behind paywalls. All the worst practices are here. Battle pass (that locks new heroes within it) and doesn't give you the currency to buy a new one if you grind it all the way. Staggeringly priced skins (on an FPS where the only thing you see is the gun). Fake currency that you can not buy the exact amount you want. Fake bundles filled with useless items to boost the price of the bundle, while there is only 1 thing that might be potentially interesting. Free updates are now repackaged as story missions with less than an hour of actual gameplay. None of this existed before. 

They killed the original game just to cram a shop in it and milk you dry. With that said...

The PvP is still good. The original game had such a phenomenal foundation, and despite almost none of the original members being left in the team, you really have to be extremely incompetent to kill such a good core. And somehow they managed to avoid this pitfall. To a point. The 5v5 change took away a huge chunk of that made the game so unique. The wacky powers and colorful cast still keep it afloat but 6v6 was created by developers considered among the best in the business. They knew what they were doing and the game was astonishing. Now, things are more homogenized.

Still, the great casual appeal can not be denied. This is the one game that allows almost any play style. Shooting, spamming, sliding, standing idle in the corner holding one button, flying, everything is here. You can have a dude with a big fist, smacking a dude with a big hammer, while a full-blown shoot-out is happening around them and the particle effects are giving you a seizure. There is also a friendly robot that can glow, speak about peace and prosperity, and can also kick you in the face, while hurling his balls at you. 

Technically, the game runs smoothly, and the character's movement and shooting still feel superb. They did downgrade a lot of stuff even on that front. Lazy animations, static and boring UI. A lackluster presentation is definitely not something you would think about a Blizzard game, but again, compared to what was before, they stripped a lot of elements and the end product doesn't feel premium as it used to. 

But you cannot ignore the problems coming from shifting focus toward greed. This thing sold 40 million copies. Whatever investment they had while developing it, those numbers should have covered it and landed them a sweet profit. Not to mention they made literally billions from the lootboxes. Another very controversial chapter in this game's history. And the thing is, as bad as it was, the new system is so much worse. Add to this the constant lies and under-delivery of broken promises and you get a very frustrated player base. The big saving grace it is not Diablo 4 or Immortal, or the Warcfart 3 debacle, so they have that going for them. 

TL:DR - still a fun PvP game, despite losing some of its uniqueness, with great casual appeal and a rich roster of incredible characters that you can easily fall in love with. Bad thing it is wrapped in one of the most egregious monetization known to man.

不了解守望先锋与暴雪的未来玩家，你们好！
这是一款目前来讲优化方面足够优秀、玩法新颖、内容丰富、CG精美、足够尊重LGBT人群等诸多优点的射击（格斗？）游戏佳作。
不管是游戏小白还是丰富游戏经验的玩家都能从中获取快乐，找到喜爱的角色。
当你在体验官方给你提供的经典模式或是富有创意的娱乐模式或是紧张刺激的排名赛中，
有趣的工坊模式更是能够发挥你们无穷想象的空间，让你不经怀疑这真的是一款免费游戏吗。
如果你从未玩过守望先锋，并不了解其身后的暴雪公司，我非常建议你下载下来体验一番，望你能玩得开心，生活愉快~

主观情绪输出：

OW1确实是款优秀的，划时代的，人人称赞的，心甘情愿为之付出时间金钱的好游戏。
客观来说OW2远远没有做成一款续作或是大版本更新本该有的模样，就UI更新？改5V5？
隔壁动视个臭不要脸的，COD好歹也是年货，年年+1，你暴雪算个几把啊！？
如果不搞歧视，用心经营游戏，听取玩家意见，我不清楚做到以上几点能否养活你们。
但却连最基本的尊重玩家都无法做到，连个体面的告别都没有，根本没有把中国玩家当人，只当做业绩里那可怜的数字。
评测里的嘴臭简直就是我的嘴替，这是我十四年来第一次为一款游戏为一家公司撰写差评，希望暴雪不能善终。
Peace&Love

Genuinely terrible monetisation, including pay-to-win nonsense due to new characters being locked behind either a paywall, or weeks of grinding. Just the fact that they are asking ~9USD (in in-game currency sold in increments of 5USD, to squeeze that extra bit from you) to skip the grind for unlocking any of the new characters is god awful.
Well, Diva is still hot af 👍

I started playing Overwatch in 2016 and it quickly became my favorite game. I played it for years until OW2  came out. Now I've quit the game.

It's a real shame how Blizzard butchered this game just because of their greed. In OW1, you could get every single cosmetic item without paying extra. In OW2, you have to pay $10 every 2 months to unlock mostly shitty cosmetics. OW1 used to have regular events with new content every time. You could really feel the love and passion, the devs put into it. Now with OW2, the only drive is pure unfiltered greed.

Just the pricetags alone are outragious. $20 for ONE SINGLE legenday skin? $15 for some PvE missions? $10 every 2 months just to be able to get ANY cosmetics?

Fuck off Blizzard. Fuck off with your insufferable greed.

The gameplay I find to be very enjoyable. Lots of unique characters with various playstyles and it runs great while looking great. But its full of issues elsewhere;
- Ranking system is horrendous. Get used to being paired with bronze teammates as you take on a 5 man diamond stack or being given silver as your rank whilst sweating yourself into a coma to be the MVP of your team. 
- The community sucks. Easily some of the worst people I've had the pleasure of interacting with. Up there with the likes of CoD, any MOBA and most twitter users.
- The monetisation is awful. By going F2P the tradeoff was that we would receive a whole PVE campaign with skill trees and such that would change how characters play. This is no longer coming but the team was happy to shoehorn in their battle pass and stupidly overpriced skins. It is pure scum what they charge for some colour swaps.
- Devs seem to not understand what the players want/refuse to implement changes or maybe the executives in charge have no clue how to run the team effectively outside of the scummy monetisation model. Seriously, the push mode sucks, get rid of it.
Other issues that plenty of others could go into in more detail but these are the big ones that stick out to me.
2016：AWESOME GAME！  2023：Piece of S.H.I.T.
